unnormalised: **Question: What are some practical yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine for better wellness?**
normalised: **Question: What are some practical yoga practices I can incorporate into my daily routine for better wellness?**

unnormalised: Okay, so a little background first. I started exploring yoga around 2 years ago, initially just because my doctor in Delhi, Dr. Sharma at Apollo, recommended it for my back pain, stemming from long hours at my desk. I work as a software engineer, and let's just say my posture wasn't doing me any favors.
normalised: Okay, so a little background first. I started exploring yoga around two years ago, initially just because my doctor in Delhi, Doctor Sharma at Apollo, recommended it for my back pain, stemming from long hours at my desk. I work as a software engineer, and let's just say my posture wasn't doing me any favors.

unnormalised: Now, I’m a convert! I find it makes a huge difference.
normalised: Now, I’m a convert! I find it makes a huge difference.

unnormalised: For practical everyday stuff, I'd suggest starting small. Surya Namaskar is a fantastic way to begin the day – even just 5 rounds can energize you. I try to do it before my 09:00 hrs team meeting. For back pain, the Bhujangasana (cobra pose) is a lifesaver. Hold it for a few breaths.
normalised: For practical everyday stuff, I'd suggest starting small. Surya Namaskar is a fantastic way to begin the day – even just five rounds can energize you. I try to do it before my nine hundred hours team meeting. For back pain, the Bhujangasana (cobra pose) is a lifesaver. Hold it for a few breaths.

unnormalised: For relaxation, try some Pranayama, like Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing). You can easily squeeze in 10 minutes of that. Savasana (corpse pose) is brilliant before bedtime; helps me sleep much better. Remember, even if you only have 15 minutes on a hectic day like, say, 26/01/2024 (Republic Day!), that's still something!
normalised: For relaxation, try some Pranayama, like Anulom Vilom (alternate nostril breathing). You can easily squeeze in ten minutes of that. Savasana (corpse pose) is brilliant before bedtime; helps me sleep much better. Remember, even if you only have fifteen minutes on a hectic day like, say, twenty sixth january two thousand and twenty four (Republic Day!), that's still something!

unnormalised: I also attended a week-long yoga retreat in Rishikesh last year, around Diwali, which really deepened my understanding. They emphasized the importance of consistency and listening to your body. Don't push yourself too hard, especially in the beginning. There's a saying they repeated: "Yoga is not about touching your toes, it's about what you learn on the way down."

unnormalised: Finally, remember to consult a qualified yoga instructor, especially if you have any pre-existing conditions. My aunt, Radha aunty, even got certified from the Morarji Desai National Institute of Yoga on 14/11/2020! Good luck on your yoga journey.
